summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding Judge Cote signing a 6(e) order in the Epstein case. It discusses secure shipping and encryption protocols for handling the sensitive material.

persons.name: Judge Cote
persons.context: Signed the 6(e) order discussed in the email.

events.title: Judge Cote signs 6(e) order
events.description: Judge Cote signed a 6(e) order related to the Epstein case, prompting internal US Attorney's Office correspondence about secure handling procedures.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Judge Cote signed a 6(e) order in the Epstein case on or before December 20, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was handling the order with strict security protocols.
Internal correspondence emphasized the need for secure shipping and electronic encryption to prevent sensitive material from being mishandled.
The document reflects ongoing legal proceedings and evidence handling in the Epstein case in late 2019.
The email discusses personnel availability around the 2019-2020 holiday season.
